project.teaser: The transition from linear fossil-based systems to circular and bio-based systems represents an opportunity and a suitable pathway for achieving several SDGs. Indeed, circular bio-based systems depict a great opportunity to reconcile sustainable long-term growth with...
project.objective: The transition from linear fossil-based systems to circular and bio-based systems represents an opportunity and a suitable pathway for achieving several SDGs. Indeed, circular bio-based systems depict a great opportunity to reconcile sustainable long-term growth with environmental protection through the prudent use of renewable resources for industrial purposes. This needed transition is a complex process, which does not simply require innovative technologies from the supply-side, but also societal transformations based on a multi-actor process. The circular bioeconomy meta-sector may be a good candidate to put forward a new economic model, which requires transformative policies, purposeful innovation, access to finance, risk-taking capacity as well as new and sustainable business models and markets. However, a critical assessment of the environmental, social and economic impacts of the current linear fossil-based economy, as well as of the improvement potential associated with circular bio-based systems, is needed to underpin the identification of policy priorities. Bearing this in mind, SUSTRACK is a three-year project aimed at supporting policymakers in their efforts to develop sustainable pathways to replace fossil and carbon-intensive systems with sustainable circular and bio-based systems (at the EU and regional scale), contributing to achieving the European Green Deal’s objectives. This will be done by: identifying environmental, economic and social limits of a linear carbon-intensive and fossil-based economy; improving existing assessment methodologies; assessing the environmental, social and economic impacts of the EU’s current linear fossil-based economy; comparing multiple transition scenarios focusing on the most carbon-intensive sectors; identifying priorities according to scenarios analysed in the project and develop guidelines and policy recommendations.
project.title: Supporting the identification of policy priorities and recommendations for designing a sustainable track towards circular bio-based systems
project.keywords: Sustainable transition, sustainability assessment, scenario analysis, policy measures

article.title: Supporting policymakers in the transition to bio-based systems

result.title: Report presenting scenarios and related policy packages
result.description: This public report will provide an overview of the work that will be conducted within Task 4.1. Specifically, it will present findings obtained by developing a baseline scenario (according to existing regulations) and a sustainable bioeconomy scenario (comprising more ambitious regulations in terms of the sustainable transition) for selected sectors and countries, with a focus on the case study sectors (WP3 and WP5) and the EU level.

result.title: Mid-term policy brief: policy priorities to support the sustainable transition and examples of good policies
result.description: This mid-term policy brief will provide an overview of the work that will be conducted within Task 5.1. Specifically, it will present preliminary findings obtained by reviewing the limits of the linear, fossil-based, and carbon-intensive economy (WP1), as well as policy-related opportunities and barriers for the sustainable transition, as identified in the literature and EU H2020 and BBI projects, through a political perspective.

result.title: Report on the prioritisation of the identified limits, as well as the preliminary guidelines and policy recommendations
result.description: This public report will provide an overview of the work that will be conducted within Task 1.3. Specifically, it will present previously identified limits that will be prioritized through pairwise comparisons based on expert judgments. Also, this report will include a list of preliminary guidelines and policy recommendations to be developed and used in WP4.

result.title: A case study selection methodology and definition of the selected case studies
result.description: This public report will provide an overview of the work that will be conducted within Task 3.1. Specifically, it will present the methodology through which case studies will be selected. For each selected case study, the scope and system boundaries will be established and presented in the report. In addition, the baseline situation and the circular, bio-based situation will be described.

result.title: Data management plan (V1)
result.description: The plan will include information on: (a) what data will be collected, processed and/or generated; (b) which methodology and standards will be applied; (c) whether data will be shared or made open access; and (d) how data will be handled and preserved (including after project completion). PC will develop the DMP based on the template provided by the EC, and update it over the course of the project.

result.title: Review of approaches and identification of research gaps
result.description: This public report will provide an overview of the work that will be conducted within Task 2.1. Specifically, it will present findings obtained by reviewing existing knowledge (pertaining to, e.g., indicators, methods, models, and data) that addresses circularity and sustainability aspects (i.e., environmental, socio-economic) at different levels (e.g., national, regional, sector, product value chain).

result.title: Initial exploitation and sustainability plan
result.description: This initial version of the the exploitation, replicability and sustainability plan will facilitate the adoption of the study results by all stakeholders, during and after the project. The plan will outline: (a) assets and their main potential exploitation routes; (b) target groups (per asset) that stand to benefit from their use; (c) the project’s innovation management strategy; (d) general terms of use and relevant IPR provisions; (e) joint exploitation plans for the consortium (or groups of partners, where relevant) and individual partners; and (f) means and procedures for the exploitation of assets, along with a clear action plan.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SUSTRACK (Supporting the identification of policy priorities and recommendations for designing a sustainable track towards circular bio-based systems)

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Barriers to transitioning to a circular bio-based economy: Findings from an industrial perspective

details.authors: Elina Dace, Alessandro Cascavilla, Marco Bianchi, Elisa Chioatto, Emy Zecca, Luana Ladu, Gülşah Yilan

result.title: Initial communication, dissemination, and stakeholder engagement report
result.description: This public report will provide the preliminary communication, dissemination, and stakeholder engagement activities that will be implemented within the second half of the project.

result.title: Report on the literature gaps and trade-offs
result.description: This public report will provide an overview of the work that will be conducted within Task 1.1. Specifically, it will present findings obtained by reviewing and analysing existing literature (with reference to both academic publications and the grey literature) and recent EU surveys on trends with respect to the environmental, economic, and social limits of the linear, carbon-intensive, and fossil-based economy.

result.title: Description of the validation methodology
result.description: This public report will provide an overview of the work that will be conducted within Task 3.2. Specifically, it will present findings obtained through validation steps that will cover the following aspects: applicability, completeness, data availability, and interpretation.The validation approach will also issue guidelines on how to identify and review relevant (publicly) available information (i.e., publications, reports, statistics) and the results of previous environmental, social, and economic assessments.

result.title: Initial dissemination and communication plan
result.description: The dissemination and communication plan will define the strategic approach for implementing tailored communication and dissemination activities to reach target audiences (i.e., ‘target’) based on planned objectives (i.e., ‘purpose’), through formats, channels, and tools (i.e., ‘method’) and the use of tailored messages (i.e., ‘content’) and monitoring indicators.

result.title: Advancement of sustainability assessment knowledge: draft
result.description: This document will provide an overview of the work that will be conducted within Task 2.2. Specifically, it will present preliminary findings obtained through desk research in order to address critical (research) gaps and develop knowledge and recommendations on how to fill those gaps.

result.title: Preliminary report on the environmental, economic, cultural and social limits of the linear, carbon-intensive and fossil-based economy
result.description: This public report will provide an overview of the work that will be conducted within Task 1.2. Specifically, it will present findings obtained by identifying and consolidating the challenges faced by the linear, fossil-based economy, related to environmental, economic, and social sustainability aspects, as well as technical, structural, and cultural barriers.

category.title: environmental sciences
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/environmental sciences

category.title: business models

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
